title: Modern Arcade Typefaces? [Stasmic?]
content:
Hi,

I'm working on the Front End for a modern arcade game. Something similar to SEGA's 'Afterburner Climax', and i'm looking for heading and body fonts.

I like the italic, smooth feel of Ray Larabie's [Stasmic](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012184330/http:/www.dafont.com/stasmic.font) but i'm worried it may be a little too light and difficult to read, even as a heading font.

Anyone fancy suggesting some suitable heading/title and body fonts?

Thanks in advance,

Dan.
author: Polypixel

comments.content: Ray would likely be willing to do a custom version for you. He comes from a games design background, so could probably work out the right licensing model too.

Have you checked the equivalent Dafont theme section?  
 [http://www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=303](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012184330/http:/www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=303 "http://www.dafont.com/theme.php?cat=303")

[plug]  
The [Feisar](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012184330/http:/type-invaders.com/feisar/) and [Feisar Express](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012184330/http:/type-invaders.com/feisar-express/) families have been developed especially to mix arcade sensibilities with good readability. Feisar comes in a nice range of weights from Extra Light to Bold for added flexibility. And although not shown on the website, a range of pixel variants are available too. :)  
[/plug]

-Paul van der Laan  
 [www.type-invaders.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012184330/http:/www.type-invaders.com/ "www.type-invaders.com")

Thanks for all your comments.

@ sii

We have actually used Ray before so a custom font is an option.

@ Fontgrube

Yes, that's where I found Stasmic.

@ PvdL

I find Feisar/Feisar Express a little too "alien/retro" for what i'm doing with this front end. On the other hand, I'm not looking for something too futuristic either.

[http://img29.imageshack.us/img29/687/headerbodycomparison.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20131012184330/http:/img29.imageshack.us/img29/687/headerbodycomparison.gif "http://img29.imageshack.us/img29/687/headerbodycomparison.gif") (Excuse the link, I can't work out the correct tags \>.\<)

Body text? I'm thinking perhaps Century Gothic Italic, though i'm far from convinced.

I'd probably recommend Neuropol. It's techy/alien without being too complicated you cant read it. I've seen a show on Discovery or the History Channel use it exclusively for the intro to some program.
